author: johnniboy

comments.content: You could probably go with [Battista](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319044124/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/preusstype/battista/) or [Normande](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319044124/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/normande/) for **nr 1**.
thanks so much marten... the FTN Farao is lovely
You're welcome. I think [ITC Founder's Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319044124/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-founders-caslon/) could work for **nr 3**.

‘Slavery’ in Nº2: similar to [Bodoni Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319044124/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/urw-bodoni/urw-bodoni-t-bold-wide/).  
‘Negroes’ in Nº3: If you want to keep the worn look: [The Fell Types](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319044124/http:/www.iginomarini.com/fell.html) might do the job quite well.  
‘all colored people’ in Nº4: similar to [Egyptienne T](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319044124/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/egyptienne/urw-egyptienne-t-bold-extra-wide/).

I agree with you on nr 2, Florian. But the R bugs me. It's more like the one in [ITC Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319044124/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ITC+Century). Is there a digital version of a Bodoni with that kind of slanted leg on the R?
